entry.title: Re: Where is Mixed MRP located in the public cloud versio...
entry.content:
Dear @SI_y_Ito,

In the current version of the Manage Product Master Data (Fiori) app, the Mixed MRP field isn’t available in the app’s UI.

This is a limitation of the standard application rather than a system configuration issue.

For now, I recommend two approaches:

  • Maintain the Mixed MRP value via MM02 (GUI for HTML).

  • Submit Feature Requests for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition: https://me.sap.com/notes/2963059

Also link below to SAP Note (Missing field in "Manage Product Master Data" app - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition):

https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/3644447

Best Regards

Dawid

entry.title: Filtering Cost Centers by Employee Division/Org Unit in Time Entry Profile
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community,

I’m working in an SAP S/4HANA system and need help understanding how to filter cost centers in the Time Entry Profile based on the division the employee belongs to.

The goal is to ensure that when employees enter their time, they only see cost centers relevant to their division. I suspect this involves configuration within the Time Entry Profile, possibly tied to organizational assignments or custom logic, but I’m unclear on the exact steps.

Has anyone implemented this kind of filtering in S/4HANA? If so:

  • What configuration steps are required?
  • Is there a standard way to link cost centers to divisions dynamically?
  • Would this require custom logic (e.g., BAdIs, business rules, or enhancements)?
  • Are there any limitations or best practices to consider?

Any guidance, examples, or documentation references would be greatly appreciated!

Thanks in advance,
Thanooja

entry.title: Update Payroll Calendar
entry.content:
Hello Team,

Every 11 years, we are in a situation with Bi-weekly payroll where the last pay period payout date falls in the new year. For Example: PP 26.2026 ends in 18th DEC 2026. The Next pay date in calendar is 1st Jan 2027.

But, we need to add another pay period 27.2026  with the pay date on 31st Dec 2026. and modify the subsequent pay periods to have the correct pay date. 

I am trying to do the same using SM30 --> V_T549S. However, I am only able to modify the dates in there but cannot add new pay period with required details. 

Could an admin who has handled such scenario help?

Thanks

Jalpan

entry.title: Steps to fetch data from S/4HANA into SAP Digital Manufacturing (DMC)
entry.content:
Dear SAP Community,

I am currently working to integrate SAP S/4HANA with SAP Digital Manufacturing and would appreciate guidance on the next steps.

I have completed the following:

Established the S/4HANA connection in my BTP account (see screenshot attached).

Created a Cloud Connector entry in the DMC Configure Production Connectivity app, including Subaccount Name, Description, and Location ID.

 

However, Learning Hub provides limited detail on how to proceed after the Cloud Connector is configured. My understanding is that I should use the Manage Integration Workflows app to fetch data from S/4HANA into DMC. I would like clarification on the required configuration steps in BTP and DMC to successfully populate master and transactional data in DMC.

Specifically, could someone please provide a step-by-step guide that addresses the following points?

Which DMC apps must be configured (for example, Manage Integration Workflows, System Configuration, etc.) and in what order?
Do I need to create or configure API services or service keys in the BTP subaccount? If so, which services and which authentication method (OAuth2 / Basic) are recommended?
What Communication Scenarios / Communication Arrangements or OData services in S/4HANA are required to expose Work Centers, Materials, and Production Orders to DMC?
Any required mappings in Cloud Connector (virtual host/port) or destination settings in BTP that typically cause integration failures?
Recommended verification steps and tests to confirm successful data flow (e.g., fetch Work Centers, import a test production order, check logs/traces).
Any sample configuration steps, screenshots, or links to up-to-date documentation or Learning Hub resources would be very helpful.

Thank you in advance for your guidance and support.


@marcobarat @ManoelCosta 
SAP Digital Manufacturing SAP Digital Manufacturing Insights

entry.title: Re: RAP cross-BO - enrich root BO obj. page create w. cross-BO info (readonly)
entry.content:
Hey @KamalDeepPareek - thank you for your insights, that helps! I'm not quite certain about the approach of the additional determination on the projection layer you mentioned, am I missing something (i.e on BO/BDEF level) or are you referring to the virtual element (incl. additional ABAP class here)?

I think creating another projection layer (something also Clément mentioned to me) which restricts the interactions on the BO (i.e. field w. "readonly : update") is a great way to go about this. Your addition to use a virtual element on the projection layer is also a good idea (here, using the ABAP class for the "determination" then). In that scenario I wouldn't even require any readonly annotations as these fields are readonly by default.

Having a determination on BO level like in Cléments case here  would require me to have these fields in the BO/DB Table itself, wouldn't it (at the very least I'd add warnings of missing persistence mapping to the BDEF)? But I think even if not, the downside would be that I'd have to go into the BO layer (BDEF + CDS Views) for adding these fields as compared to using the virtual element approach which I can add in the projection layer.

  • If this object is indeed not supported in the standard migration cockpit, did you end up using LSMW or another workaround?
  • Any lessons learned or recommendations would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Re: RAP cross-BO - enrich root BO obj. page create w. cross-BO info (readonly)
entry.content:
Hey @junwu, I was able to test this approach. TLDR: Works! 😃

To roughly sum it up one last time:

  • 2 Associations on projection level of the root BO 'Order' (one to the original cross BO projection - unrestricted, one to another projection with restricted field access i.e. "readonly" - this could also just have been a simple CDS view without behavior projection and the 'readonly' part could've been solely done using annotations then)
  • 2 virtual elements (e.g.: IsCrossBOCustomerHidden, IsAssocCustomerHidden - names may vary 🍻) on projection level of the root BO 'Order', implemented in an ABAP class where you read the 'Customer' BO via EML (figure out if you find something where "isDraft" is set) and set the virtual elements to true/false accordingly, which is then picked up by the dynamicaly controlled 'hidden' property of the two facets (each one of them pointing to one of the above mentioned associations) thus enabling or disabling the given facet allowing for more dynamic field control

Thanks again! 🙂

entry.title: 🎃 SAP Community Meetup NYC – Halloween Edition (Arcade Series #2)
entry.content:
Hi Community,

I’m beyond excited to announce the second series of our SAP Community Meetup in New York City Arcade! 🕸️

After the incredible success of our inaugural event, we’re back — this time with a Halloween twist. The goal remains the same: to continue building a vibrant SAP Community Hub right here in the heart of the Big Apple, where innovation meets connection (and a bit of spooky fun).

This edition is also an Avvalers Meetup Event, proudly organized by Avvale — bringing together our network of innovators, technologists, and SAP enthusiasts who are shaping the future of enterprise solutions.

Whether you’re into SAP, AI, BTP, or just great company, this is your chance to meet fellow professionals, share ideas, and enjoy the night in a creative, informal setting.

 

 

🕷️ Where and When

📅 Date: October, 2025
🕖 Time: 7:00 PM – 10:30 PM
📍 Venue: 148 W 24th St, New York, NY 10011
[Google Map link]

👻 Theme: Come as you are…

🧛 Agenda

As always, we’ll keep it informal:

  • 🗣️ Open conversations about SAP technology, innovation, and community

  • 💡 Mini “lightning talks” — anyone can grab the mic for 5 minutes!

  • 🎮 Networking with retro arcade games and craft beers

  • 🍕 Halloween snacks & treats

🦇 Who’s Invited

Everyone!
Whether you’re a consultant, architect, developer, student, or SAP newcomer, you’re welcome to join. Bring your curiosity, your questions, and maybe your best vampire grin.

📸 Note

Feel free to reach out to me for any queries or clarifications.
Food and drinks are not sponsored.

🧡
Sebastiano
SAP Champion | NYC Community Organizer
Proudly supported by Avvale

entry.title: Re: CDS view about service order and purchase requisition
entry.content:
Goood day @Lily16 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at these references, they provide more detailed guidance.

Service Order Management

https://api.sap.com/api/API_SERVICE_ORDER_SRV/overview

https://api.sap.com/cdsviews/I_PURCHASEREQUISITIONITEMAPI01

In summary, no, there is no single released CDS view that directly joins Service Order to Purchase Requisition in one dataset. However, you can derive the linkage when you combine the following released CDS views that expose the same keys.

The link between a Service Order and its Purchase Requisition exists in the standard CDS views I_ServiceOrderItem and I_PurchaseRequisitionItemAPI01. You can expose both directions through a Custom CDS View without accessing unreleased tables.

Alternatively, though more technical, if you work through the procurement side, the same link is available in I_PurchaseRequisitionItemAPI01.ServiceOrder and I_PurchaseRequisitionItemAPI01. ServiceOrderItem. This means you can also start from the Purchase Requisition CDS view and join back to the Service Order CDS view instead of the other way around

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Order combination flag ignored in STO delivery creati...
entry.content:
Good day @cvlokven 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at these references, they provide more detailed guidance.

Stock Transport Order (OData V4), Stock Transport Order with Delivery via Shipping

Delivery Split for Outbound Delivery Order, Advanced Shipping and Receiving

To summarise, in public cloud, the Order Combination flag is not evaluated for Stock Transport Orders (STOs). This is intended because multi-STO delivery combination is not supported due to architectural and compliance constraints in the SaaS environment. Each STO acts as distinct controlling document for replenishment delivery creation due to the differences in the delivery creation framework. There is also no BAdI that allows combining deliveries across multiple STOs, that logic is only provided in the CIF-restricted Private Cloud Edition.

It worked in Onpremise or Private Cloud because BAdIs such as, LE_SHIP_DELIVERY_PROC or LE_SHP_SUPRESS_DEL_SPLIT could be used to override delivery split logic, which also included STO deliveries.

In Public Cloud, these implementations are not released due to the clean core principles and restricted ABAP layer.

In your use case, if delivery grouping is a business requirement, I suggest you consider Advanced Shipping & Receiving or TM integration. They are the supported frameworks for consolidation in the public cloud.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: My expert playlist, SAP TechEd, Berlin
entry.content:
Hello, dear influencers, experts, fans, and friends from the SAP Community!

It’s finally that time of the year again: SAP TechEd Season!
This year feels extra special to me—it’s the first SAP TechEd happening in Germany since I moved here, and I couldn’t be more excited.

When it comes to building my personal TechEd agenda, it has never been both so easy and so difficult at the same time.

Why difficult?
Because my curiosity is endless. Over my (long) SAP career, I’ve worked across many areas: from writing ABAP code to designing modern user interfaces, from integration to solution and enterprise architecture—where technology truly meets business. I love exploring how technology and business merge, so naturally, I’d like to attend almost every session across the board.

Why easy?
Because priorities are clear this year: AI.
My laser focus will be on everything around custom AI scenarios—how we as engineers can build AI extensions, create Joule AI agents, and leverage the SAP AI Foundation. I believe many of the new challenges (and opportunities!) will emerge here, and I can’t wait to discover how SAP’s newest innovations will empower us.

That said, I’ve shortlisted around 30 sessions I’d love to attend. Realistically, some I’ll have to catch later via SAP TechEd Virtual—but here are my Top 3 “must-watch” sessions:

🚀My Top 3 SAP TechEd 2025 Sessions

  • CT1245 | Hugging Face Transformers in AI Foundation
    I’m learning Hugging Face models, so I’m curious to see how they work within the SAP AI Foundation. This feels like a new superpower for building advanced AI scenarios.

  • AI160 | Build your own AI agent–based solution with the generative AI hub
    Agents are another game-changing technology. Spending two hours diving deep into building custom AI agents to extend SAP products sounds like time very well invested.

  • PAR102 | From MCP to Joule: Unlocking SAP data and AI innovation with Microsoft
    I’ve been exploring how SAP AI Foundation can be integrated with cloud providers beyond the Generative AI Hub. This session will be a great opportunity to hear directly from Microsoft experts on their approach.

  • Bonus: AI101 | Optimize prompts and explore models with the generative AI hub
    Prompt engineering is one of the core skills for creating effective custom AI solutions. This session promises plenty of practical insights to sharpen that skill.

Of course, I wish I could attend everything—but thankfully, many sessions will be available later via SAP TechEd Virtual.

In addition to the AI-focused ones, I’ll also keep a close eye on all sessions related to Joule in the context of ABAP and CAP development—because at the end of the day, AI custom scenarios often start right there (with a little help from Python 😉).

🙌Final Thoughts

To all my fellow SAP Community colleagues:
I wish you an inspiring and knowledge-packed SAP TechEd season. May your curiosity be fueled and your learning appetite at least partly satisfied.

Let’s keep in touch and exchange our learnings in the weeks to come.

All the best,
Douglas

entry.title: Difference between ECC CO Production Order and S/4HANA Public Cloud PP Production Order (3F0)
entry.content:
We are migrating from SAP ECC to SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition.

In ECC, we use CO Production Orders for manufacturing cost management.
In S/4HANA Public Cloud, we understand that Scope Item 3F0 (PP Production Order) is used instead.

Could you please clarify:
1. What are the main functional differences between ECC CO Production Order and S/4HANA Public Cloud PP Production Order?
2. What functionalities are available in PP Production Order (3F0)?
3. What functionalities from ECC CO Production Order are NOT available in S/4HANA Public Cloud?
4. Are there any alternative approaches to cover the gap?

entry.title: Alternative to ECC Cost Planning Transactions (KP06, KP26, KSPI, KSII) in S/4HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
We are migrating from SAP ECC to SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition.

In ECC, we use the following transactions for cost rate calculation:
- KP06: Cost input
- KP26: Quantity input
- KSPI: Unit price calculation
- KSII

We understand that in S/4HANA Public Cloud, the recommended apps are:
- F3162: Manage Cost Rates - Plan
- F3422: Manage Cost Rates - Actual

Questions:
1. Can we still use KP06, KP26, KSPI, KSII transactions in S/4HANA Public Cloud?
2. What functionalities are NOT available with F3162 and F3422 compared to the ECC transactions?
3. Our current process calculates the following standard rates using KP06/KP26/KSPI:
- Standard labor rate
- Standard factory overhead rate
- Standard subcontracting rate
- Standard product overhead rate
- Post-process common overhead rate

Can we achieve the same calculations using F3162/F3422 in S/4HANA Public Cloud?

entry.title: Automatic GL Account Substitution Based on Cost Center and GL Account in S/4HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
We are migrating from SAP ECC to SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition.

Current ECC Process:
When posting costs to specific Cost Centers and GL Accounts, the system automatically converts and posts to designated GL accounts based on a conversion table.

Business Rules:
1. If Cost Center = R&D Department → automatically post to "Research & Development Expenses" GL account
2. If Cost Center = SGA AND GL Account = 9XX (SGA accounts) → automatically post to "Selling, General & Administrative Expenses (for P&L display)" GL account

Conversion happens in real-time during posting using a custom conversion table (Cost Center + GL Account → Target GL Account).

Questions:
1. Is this type of automatic GL account substitution possible in S/4HANA Public Cloud?
2. If yes, which app or scope item should we use?
3. What is the recommended approach for this requirement in S/4HANA Public Cloud?

entry.title: Best practice for changing the default currency of analytical Fiori Tiles in S/4HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
Dear Ladies and Gentlemen,

I found an read some SAP notes for my task of changing the default currency of analytical Fiori Tiles in S/4HANA Public Cloud, but I am not really sure, what is the best practice and the easyest way to do this.

The user profile settings for language and the default values > General > Display Currency obviously have no effect on the analytical tiles for example in the space "Accounts receivable" > Analytics (there was also a note that this just works for some tiles)

Also there does not seem to be another globel setting for the S/4HANA tenants to change the standard currency for all tiles from USD to EUR as far as I see?

So the only way really seems to be to user the "Manage KPIs and Reports" app auf S/4HANA Public Cloud and change the default currency the in the settings of each indivdual KPI (for eacht tile) and then transport this?

And probably now in S/4HANA Public Cloud I can do this directly in the KPIs provided by SAP without the need to copy each tile and KPI and create custom versions for currency = EUR for all those tiles (as it was proposed in earlier S/4HANA on premise versions)? And those settings will not be overwritten with the next S/4HANA cloud release?

Thanks a lot and kind regards


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Best practice for changing the default currency of an...
entry.content:
Dear Sender,

Hope you are doing well!

Since the behind technology of apps uses are different, the way to change the default currency is different.

Basically, for SAP delivered analytical tiles:

Steps to change the default currency in a Story (eg.URL: https://fioriappslibrary.hana.ondemand.com/sap/fix/externalViewer/#/detail/Apps('F4401')/S33 - Application Type: Analytical, BW Query used (SAP Fiori: SAP Analytics Cloud story)).

  • The standard application supports default values. To check for the same, > Go to Manage KPIs and Reports app > stories > Select Aging Analysis > Applications tab > Click on the tile > Default values is set. For more information, please refer to Maintaining Your Default User Values | SAP Help Portal .
  • If the application supports Variants, you can create a public and default variant. (Refer to 3047239 - How to change the displayed currency in Aging Report for Accounts Payable App - SAP for Me ). 

    • The user has to do a one-time activity:

      1. Load the application.
      2. Click on the variants (down arrow).
      3. Click on "Manage".
      4. Select the new currency variant as "favorite" (star icon) and set it as default.
      5. After reloading, the new default variant will be available for the end user.

      (Data Analyzer and Story Analysis | SAP Help Portal > Features: Manage Variants).

        
      
  • It is possible to make a copy of the Story using the Manage KPIs and Reports app > Stories tab > Select "Aging Report for Accounts Payable" > Click on Copy.

 

Steps to change the default currency in a Report (eg.URL: https://fioriappslibrary.hana.ondemand.com/sap/fix/externalViewer/#/detail/Apps('F1733')/S33 - Application Type: Analytical (SAP Fiori: SAP Smart Business generic drill down app)).

  • The standard application supports default values. This can be checked in Manage KPIs and Reports app > Reports > Select Aging Analysis > Applications tab > Click on the tile > Default values is set. For more information, please refer to Maintaining Your Default User Values | SAP Help Portal .
  • It is possible to change the default value by editing the KPI. This can be done in Manage KPIs and Reports app > Reports > Select Aging Analysis > Click on KPI Source "Payable Amount" > Details > Click on Edit > Change the default value.
  • It is possible to make a copy of the Group/KPI/Report by using the Copy functionality. This can be done in Manage KPIs and Reports app > KPI > Groups tab > Select Aging Analysis > Click on Copy.

 

Your settings can be transported to your latter systems and the settings will not be overwritten with the next S/4HANA Pubic Cloud release.

Hope this clarified to you and thanks for your understanding.

Thanks and Best Regards,
Bell

entry.title: SAP业务数据云中的Data Products数据产品概况介绍
entry.content:
如果您对BTP感兴趣，BTP个人精选内容目录 | SAP Blogs 可能有更多你需要的内容

 

 

Data Products是什么？

Data Products，是一种可复用的数据模型。是SAP业务数据云(Business Data Cloud, BDC)的核心概念。它不仅仅是原始数据，而是包含了业务上下文、语义和标准化API接口的完整模型。

在BDC中，Data Products扮演着"数据产品化"的关键角色，负责将SAP和非SAP源的数据转换为可直接消费的数据模型

 

 

SAP开发Data Products的目的是什么？

传统数据集成的痛点

在没有Data Products概念时，企业分析师面临巨大挑战：需要从多个SAP系统的数百张表中手动提取、转换、合并数据，不仅工作量巨大，还容易产生数据不一致和重复劳动的问题。就像每次做菜都要从种菜开始，效率极低且质量难以保证。

Data Products的解决方案

Data Products通过"数据产品化"理念彻底改变这一现状：

  • 标准化封装：将复杂的数据提取逻辑封装成标准化产品，一次构建，多次复用
  • 业务语义保持：保留SAP系统原有的业务上下文，让数据"自带说明书"
  • 开箱即用：提供预构建的业务数据集，分析师可以直接消费而无需关心底层复杂性

在BDC生态中的协同作用

Data Products与BDC其他功能形成完整闭环：通过BDC Cockpit统一管理，与SAP Datasphere集成进行深度建模，通过SAP Analytics Cloud实现可视化分析，与SAP Databricks共享扩展AI/ML能力，构建端到端的企业数据分析解决方案。

 

 

Data Products可以用来干什么？

Data Products代表了数据模型，而数据模型可以为很多场景服务，例如分析，计划，预测，情景模拟

这里先概括Data Products的三种使用模式

  • 直接使用预置Data Products：适合标准业务场景，开箱即用，快速见效，常用在智能应用中
  • 定制预置Data Products：适合有特殊需求的企业，在标准基础上灵活调整
  • 从零开发自定义Data Products：适合独特业务模式，完全定制化数据产品

 

目前可用的预置Data Products列表：Link

 

Data Products和市面上类似功能有什么区别？

1. Data Products本身的独特功能优势

  • 业务语义完整性：不仅提供数据，更保持SAP系统原有的业务上下文，如自动关联产品描述、供应商信息、货币单位等
  • 自描述能力：每个Data Product包含完整的接口定义、技术文档和语义关系，实现真正的自服务数据消费

就像购买成品家具而非原材料，既有完整功能又有使用说明书

2. 基于BTP和BDC的平台效应

  • 统一管理体验：通过BDC Cockpit提供单一控制面板，避免在多个工具间切换的复杂性
  • 平台级服务共享：享受SAP BTP的安全、监控、治理等基础设施，无需自建数据管理平台

就像住在配套完善的智能社区，所有基础设施都是现成的

3. 与SAP生态的完美结合

  • 深度集成：与SAP S/4HANA、SuccessFactors等产品原生集成，支持实时数据同步
  • 统一体验：共享SAP Fiori设计语言，为SAP用户提供一致的操作体验
  • 预构建内容：提供针对SAP业务流程优化的数据产品库，实现"即插即用"

就像苹果生态系统，各产品间无缝协作，用户体验一致

相比其他数据平台需要复杂的业务语义重建工作，Data Products为SAP客户提供了"即插即用"的数据管理能力，特别适合以SAP为核心的企业IT环境。

 

 

Data Products该怎么用呢？

实施步骤概览

1.环境准备,在BDC Cockpit中配置全局账户权限

2.激活数据包：

  • 通过SAP Business Accelerator Hub浏览可用的数据包和数据产品
  • 在BDC Cockpit中激活所需的数据包，使其包含的Data Products在数据目录中可用

3.数据产品安装和共享

  • SAP Datasphere用户可将Data Products权限分配到指定空间用于建模
  • 或通过目录将Data Products共享给SAP Databricks进行AI/ML扩展

4.部署和应用

  • 利用SAP Analytics Cloud创建仪表板和报告，实现数据可视化，或者是通过智能应用一键部署标准分析方案

预期效果

  • 业务用户赋能：业务专家无需复杂的技术技能即可访问和分析企业数据，实现自助式数据消费
  • 开发效率提升：预构建的Data Products和智能应用模板大幅减少数据准备和应用开发时间
  • 数据治理增强：统一的数据产品目录和访问控制确保数据质量和合规性，建立企业级数据信任体系

 

 

 

关于本文内容有任何问题或见解，欢迎在评论区留下你的想法，如果时间紧迫，也可以直接联系到我 arthuryang1996@foxmail.com，感谢你的时间

  3.

Thank you for your assistance.

 

Best regards,


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Request for Official List of Email Notification Domai...
entry.content:
Regarding to your questions, please refer to KBA 3481022 - Different types of notifications - SAP for Me

Abstract below information for your reference:

Support-related Notifications

  • Notifications about various applications in SAP for Me, e.g. customer cases, SAP Notes & KBAs, User Management, SAP HotNews, Service Requests, license key, legal change announcement, SAP Passport, etc. 
  • Subscription is configured in Support-Related Notifications application (KBA 2530034)
  • Notifications come from email box notification-service@sap.com

Cloud System maintenance/outage/downtime Notifications

  • Notifications about incidents (service disruptions, degradations) and scheduled maintenance and upgrade events occurring with cloud products
  • Visit page Supported Products to check the supported cloud products and system types
  • Subscription is configured in Cloud Systems Notification Subscriptions (Get Notified) application (KBA 2896942 and 2900069)
  • Notifications come from email box sapcloudsupport@alerts.ondemand.com

SAP for Me Status Notifications

  • Notifications about the service availability and overall performance of SAP for Me
  • Subscription is configured in SAP for Me Status Page (KBA 2507656)
  • Notifications come from email box noreply@statuspage.io

entry.title: Bank Account Mandatory without Removing Delete Permission from Onboarding External User
entry.content:
We are exploring ways to make bank account number required for onboardees in Personal Data Collection, without removing the delete functionality. Is there a way to do this? SAP Note 3076751 walks through making fields mandatory, but states that the delete permission must be removed.

Our main issue with removing delete functionality from for the onboardee is that some countries are only allowed to submit one payment method. If they start an additional bank without being able to remove, they will receive an error that they can only have one bank, and wouldn't be able to proceed. They would be forced to refresh and lose all of the data previously entered, leading to a very poor user experience.

entry.title: Re: Production variance settlement to CO-PA (instead of C...
entry.content:
Good day @JavierIbanez 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at these references, they provide more detailed guidance.

Event-Based Reporting, Settlement Rules of Manufacturing Orders (Event-Based Posting Rules)

SAP Central Finance & Margin Analysis (new COPA), Cost Elements

Universal Allocation in SAP S/4HANA 2022, Universal Allocation

Answer to question 1: No, in public cloud Substitutions/settlement redirections for production variances to a cost center (like on-prem) are not supported. PRD --> CO-PA is what the system permits.

Answer to question 2: You can keep the technical prices cost center at zero without manual CO-PA JE by using Universal Allocation. The sender must equal the cost center, whilst excluding PRD G/Ls. Receiver must equal Profitability Segment. You have to schedule monthly. This yields automatic clearing and avoids double-counting PRD.

Answer to question 3: Today, this is not supported in public cloud due to its clean-core approach. If it is critical, i suggest you submit a request via the Customer Influence channel.

Here is a step by step guide.

Search Margin Analysis-Line Items -->

Filter by G/L Account (PRD accounts & Posting Period) --> Confirm entries show Profitability Segment (PSG)

To confirm which G/Ls are PRD vs. non-PRD on your technical prices cost center, go to Display Line Items in General Ledger --> Filter Cost center= technical prices, Period, and G/L range involved. Identify which G/Ls are PRD and which are other ML/price-diff balances you need to allocate. Exclude PRD G/Ls from the allocation sender selection.

Ensure you have a secondary cost element for allocation. Open Manage G/L Account Master Data --> create or check a G/L type to be used by Universal Allocation.

Thereafter, Open Manage Allocation to defined Universal Allocation --> Create Cycle à Category= Overhead Allocation or Assessment. Segment-Sender: Sender Object= Cost Center. Sender Filter on G/L Account= include non PRD G/Ls only. Segment-Receiver: Receiver Object= Profitability Segment (Use your CO-PA characteristics). Tracing Factor: choose an appropriate basis. Allocation Cost Element: choose the secondary cost element from previous step. The purpose is to automate clearing of non-PRD balances from the CC to CO-PA, leaving the CC at zero without touching the PRD again.

Test Run the cycle for the period, if correct then execute productive run. Review the Allocation Results link. This confirms postings clear the cost center and flow to CO-PA automatically

Next is to validate the technical prices. Open Cost Center-Actuals and filter the CC and period after the run.

Finally, you need to schedule each period. Open Manage Allocation, schedule your cycle monthly. This avoids manual postings by keeping FI and CO reconciled period-end.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Automatic consumption of consignment stock for production order components using 261 movement
entry.content: I think, you have to set the components in backflush in order to automatically consume the items when doing 261 transactions otherwise, it will not automatically consume the components even if it goes through 261. If you are using MIGO to do manual 261, you can manually input the components you want to consume even if they are not set to backflush.

entry.title: Re: Tableau Connection with S/4HANA public Cloud
entry.content:
Good day @shahidiqbal 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at these references, they provide more detailed guidance.

SAP KBA 3609991, https://help.tableau.com/current/pro/desktop/en-us/examples_odata.htm

Blog: Table access in S/4HANA Cloud

In summary, the public cloud does not allow you to connect Tableau directly to the public cloud. However, it provides a connection possibility through standard OData APIs. You can use Communication Arrangement, Communication User and OData URL (that you can past into Tableau’s connector).

The reason for the restriction is, in the public cloud, SAP restricts database-level access to protect security, maintaining upgrade stability and enforce the clean-core approach upon which the public cloud SaaS model was built. Therefore, restricting access to released APIs or CDS views.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Multiple email sent for custom email notification onb...
entry.content: Hi Gopi, I have revised to the following instead. Currently instead of triggering 8 emails, it is triggering 2 emails. I have raised a ticket and SAP is looking into this. I have created 1 email category, 1 email trigger and 8 email templates (with dynamic recipients) in Email Services. I have inserted a Filter business rule to each of the 8 email templates in email services whereby the IF condition determines which division's HRBP will receive the email, as each email template has different dynamic recipients. At the object definition > Process, I have created business rule whereby once additional onboarding data collection step is completed and if Onboardee selects "Yes" to the COI declaration form, the email template created in Email Services will be triggered, the Filter business rule will determine which dynamic group should receive the email based on the division of onboardee.

entry.title: Re: Exceptional Aggregation

entry.title: Is splitting valuation function available in UPA (universal parallel accounting)
entry.content:
Dear Experts, 

 We are implementing S/4 project, the product version is S/4HANA 2023, we are going to use UPA function, but not sure the splitting valuation is available if we choose UPA solution.

the background is: for finish goods and semi finish goods,  it might be self-made or purchased from IC company, so we need splitting valuation function to use one material code, different valuation type to manage it, can we calculate material cost per valuation type in 4G ledger?

Best Regards,

Linda

BR, 

Linda

entry.title: Re: SEN Content database available after contract duration
entry.content:
Hi Maggy,

Approximately 3 months after the Enable Now contract has been terminated, the Enable Now tenant is permanently deleted.  Prior to that point, individual customers must extract whatever information that they wish to keep from their environment.  Once the tenant has been deleted, there is no way for SAP to restore that content if the customer changes their mind in the future.

The options to extract the content from your Enable Now system are discussed in the following information sessions:

US friendly time
Registration page (Nov 7)

APAC friendly time
Registration page (Dec 3)

European friendly time
Registration page (Dec 3)

Regards
Shane

entry.title: SAP Document AI in SAP MDG using Intelligent Scenario Lifecycle Management (ISLM)
entry.content:
Introduction

In this blog, let us understand how to leverage SAP Intelligent Scenario Lifecycle Management (ISLM) to manage Generative AI and AI business services in the SAP MDG. This blog mainly focuses on how to use one of the AI Business Services i.e. Document AI in MDG via ISLM. It is formerly known as Document Information Extraction (DIE).

MDG Scenario

The scenario is to derive the address details from vendor registration PDF document which will be uploaded in the MDG change request. SAP Document AI from BTP is used to read the details from a PDF document and derive the data into MDG change request.

Implementation

1. BTP

First of all, The BTP account is needed to create instance on the AI business service - SAP Document AI to read data from PDF. If you do not have a BTP account, please refer this link to create a BTP trial account Get an Account on SAP BTP Trial | SAP Tutorials.

You can find the SAP Document AI Trail (DIE) in the service marketplace to create an instance.

Please make sure instance as well as service key is created. The service key is used later in the ISLM connection mapping configuration.

Please subscribe to SAP Document AI UI application

Assign Role Collection to your user in Security.

To simplify all the above setup, you can use Booster as alternative to setup the SAP Document AI in BTP.

PDF Document

Please find sample PDF document which will be used as a document template to setup in the SAP Document AI.

Schema Configuration 

Create a custom schema in SAP Document AI Application to extract fields from PDF document.

Add Header Fields

Add header fields in the custom schema to map with PDF document. All the fields such as FirstName, LastName, House No, Street, postal code etc. from PDF to map with business partner fields in MDG change request.

Activate the schema after all the fields are added.

 

Create Template

Template in SAP Business AI that uses schema and associated document. You could edit the extraction results of the associated documents to teach SAP Document AI where certain field values are located on the document to improve the accuracy of the extraction.

There is no associated document, so we need to add PDF document now in Documents.

Add Document

Add the PDF document in the Documents in SAP Document AI application and map the schema fields with PDF fields.

Add this document to template

Now, click on Add to Template Button to add this document to custom template created in one of the above steps.

Activate template

Access Template on the left navigation pane to activate it.

Now, all the setup related to SAP Document AI is completed.

2. Intelligent Scenario Lifecycle Management (ISLM) in MDG System

  • ISLM is part of the ABAP Platform offered as core functionality in ABAP stack. 
  • ISLM Framework is developed in SAP BASIS Component from ABAP Platform 2020 delivery with SAP BASIS  755 / 7.8x onwards.
  • ISLM facilitates and helps to consume the Machine learning scenarios with an ABAP based Business Application seamlessly
  • ISLM helps to integrate AI and AI Business services into MDG system (S/4HANA).
  • ISLM offers an end-to-end framework to manage both pre-delivered and custom AI scenarios in SAP S/4HANA.

In this example, would like to walk through custom AI-DAR scenario through ISLM.

The below configuration is to be completed in MDG system to enable ISLM related applications.

  • Setting up the OData Services
  • Setting up the bgRFC Queue
  • Configuring Business Roles for the Backend
  • Configuring Business Roles for the Frontend

Please make sure that role SAP_BR_ANALYTICS_SPECIALIST is assigned to the user which is required to access the below Intelligent Scenario Apps. 

 

Click on Intelligent Scenarios App to create an intelligent scenario to consume AI business service SAP Document AI (DIE).

As you may aware, SAP ISLM provides two options as Embedded and Side-by-Side. In this example, would like to cover side-by-side scenario. So, click on create Button to initiate a side-by-side scenario creation.

 

Enter Scenario Name, Description and Type as Document Information Extraction.

It is recommended to use $TMP local package in ISLM until the Intelligent scenario is developed and tested thoroughly. After finalization, create the application package specific intelligent scenario. ISLM creates 'Intelligent Scenario' as an ABAP Object (Transportable / added to a TR based on catalog/package).

Create a prediction class with interface IF_ISLM_INTS_SBS_DOCX which will be assigned in the intelligent scenario.

The intelligent scenario could be published after all the above steps are done.

Maintain connection mapping between intelligent scenario and SAP Document AI (DIE) service (BTP) using service key and oAuth profile through the transaction ISLM_CONN_MAP.

In the Intelligent scenario management App, the deployment of intelligent scenario needs to be activated.

3. Master Data Governance (MDG)

In MDG, Cross entity derivation BADI could be used to call the Document AI via ISLM in MDG change request. In the BADI, it will read the name and address details using Document AI from PDF, which is attached in the MDG CR, and it will derive this information in the CR.

Execution

To execute this scenario, attach the PDF document in the MDG CR header and select BP grouping in the CR, it will trigger the BADI to derive the name and address details from PDF to MDG change request.

The file name and file title could be any and it is not fixed to any particular name.

Now, the name and address details are derived in the CR from PDF document.

Conclusion

In this blog post, we have learnt how to derive fields in the MDG change request from PDF document using SAP Document AI via ISLM.

entry.title: Re: Maximize the value of HR data – Introducing People Intelligence
entry.content: Awesome blog @VenkatPS

entry.title: Correct approach to get the staging and active data in rule context BADI?
entry.content:
Dear All

I have a Jira - to set modified flag on the plant status(MSTAE, MMSTA) for the material(change CR) in the rule context BADI.

Below are the steps followed

- Created a change flag in the single value decision table(with condition alias), for this condition alias maintained data in user agent decision table

- Created service name 

- Implemented rule context BADI with filter as earlier created service name

- Only in material change CR(not create CR), for the plant status modification changes, I have to check the staging and active values and set modified flag.

 Getting the staging data using API and active data using tables MARA and MARC.

staging data

model_ref->read_char_value(
i_readmode = if_usmd_db_adapter=>gc_readmode_no_act

 

May i know if this the right approach ?

Or getting the active data also using 

model_ref->read_char_value(
i_readmode = if_usmd_db_adapter=>gc_readmode_no_inact

 

Please provide your suggestions.

 

regards

Chandra.

entry.title: New plant code for 3PL Warehouse Integration in S/4HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
In our current S/4HANA Public Cloud setup, plant code is integrated with the DHL 3PL warehouse.

DHL currently manages our customers’ warehouse operations. However, they will be transitioning to a new warehouse partner.

As part of the warehouse transition, we are planning to create a new plant code in the S/4HANA Public Cloud system. It's intend to create a new plant code to support the upcoming warehouse setup.

Is there any utility tool or standard program available to identify all configurations and technical objects adjusted due to this plant migration transition?

entry.title: create rebate agreement VBO1 in SD module which can get quantity and discount slab dynamically
entry.content:
• 1) GROUP for this group There are three companies in this group with three different names.

SLAB

DISC. RS.

+50

600

+200

800

+500

1000

+800

1150

+1200

1300

+1800

1400

  •  Quantity-Linked Discount for All on a Monthly Basis (Monthly Spot Qty Discount):

SOLD TO PARTY

QTY

GROUP SLAB ON TOTAL QTY

DYNAMICALLY APPLIED SLAB

COMPANY -1

229.365

1300

800

COMPANY -2

741.825

1300

1000

COMPANY -3

441.135

1300

800

TOTAL GROUP QTY

1412.325

 

 

 

We have to explore the desired solution so as to create a new condition like “s.org/material or product hierarchy/sold to party (payer) customer group code (NPL GROUP)/payer.”

Where “payer” will decide total D.I. quantity (discount quantity is decided based on D.I. DATE) from the “from” and “to” dates, and “sold to party (payer) customer group code (NPL GROUP)” will decide total group quantity for discount slab.

2) Customer’s Discount (consumer spot discount): for those customers who lift material through one or more different dealers.

QTY. SLAB

DISC. RS/PMT

+750

300

+2000

400

+4000

500

+5500

600

 

DEALER -1

QTY

GROUP SLAB ON TOTAL QTY

DYNAMICALLY APPLIED SLAB

CUSTOMER-XYZ

278.145

300

0

DEALER-2

 

 

 

CUSTOMER-XYZ

1259.370

300

300

TOTAL

1537.515

 

 

 

For this we will have to create a condition like “s.org/material or product hierarchy/ship to party customer group code/payer.”

Where “payer” will decide total D.I. quantity (discount quantity is decided based on D.I. DATE) on from and to date, and “ship to party customer group code (NPL GROUP)” quantity will decide discount slab. 

 

SECOND SCENARIO

1. CONSUMER CONTRACT DISCOUNT

S.ORG/MATERIAL OR PRODUCT HEIRARCHY/SALES TERMS/CONTRACT QTY/SHIP TO PARTY GROUP CODE OR CONSUMER CODE

CONTRACT QTY SHOULD DECIDE PERCENTAGE OF LIFTED QTY BASED ON SHIP TO PARTY GROUP CODE QUANTITY AND PICK DISCOUNT SLAB BASED ON PERCENTAGE.

SHIP TO PARTY GROUP CODE OR CODE WILL DECIDE REAL LIFTING QUANTITY.

 
  1. DEALER CONTRACTUAL DISCOUNT BASED ON BASIC PRICE

S.ORG/MATERIAL OR PRODUCT HEIRARCHY/SALES TERMS/BASIC PRICE/ CONTRACT QTY/PAYER GROUP CODE OR CODE

BASIC PRICE WILL DECIDE DISCOUNT SLAB BASED ON BASIC PRICE DISCOUNT SLAB.

CONTRACT QTY SHOULD DECIDE PERCENTAGE OF LIFTED QTY BASED ON PAYER GROUP CODE QUANTITY AND PICK DISCOUNT SLAB BASED ON PERCENTAGE IN REFERENCE WITH THE ABOVE BASIC PRICE.

PAYER GROUP CODE OR CODE WILL DECIDE REAL LIFTING QUANTITY.

Or we can create a different criterion condition for the individual and then club with multiple conditions at the agreement level sequentially.
